Description.value: Wrong ingredients in. Junk come out. If only you used the Recipedia...
A bulbous protein rich berry. Clever monkeys can cook it into almost any yummy delicacy.
Once, the living trunk of a majestic tree. Now dead.
Cool clear pond water. Scum free!
Rough stone from a local mountain.
Stout and full of water. You can shoot fish in it.
A hard wood that has lived a hard life. Misses its baby acorns.
Fresh, hot loafs right out of the oven. Try slices dribbled with honey and melted butter.
The finest red clay bricks this side of Greater Flandon.
Distilled berries yield a harsh liquor that puts hair in places you really don't want hair.
Planks hand-planed by an elderly master craftsman. Each wood shaving is so fine you can see the sunset shine through.
Dab a little of this under your chin and the flan come runnin'
Sparkly bits of glitter cut with a water wheel.
Savory stew made from roots, sausage and your mother's soupy secrets. The steam fogs your glasses.
Fractured stone under great heat reveals a metallic core. Ore! Go forth and forge a vast industry!
The nubby petals, when ground in a Flannish mortar, produce a red powder that sets the senses aflame.
Twelve parts sand, three parts trona, two parts lime. Brought to a bubble and then made into church windows.
The home cooked meal you miss so much.
A white fruit-based flour used for baking. Also fun to jump into and pretend you are a ghost.
Food of the gods. The gods unfortunately were machines, so consuming mana tends to make one's tongue blister.
An intoxicating staple of winter nights spent with friends 'round a table full of food and song.
Items of worship mass produced for mass.
A poisonous beverage favored by ex-lovers and spiteful goldfish owners.
Love in a bottle. Sold in bulk to certified therapists.
Each flask contains a guaranteed five additional minutes of life. Drink slowly to avoid exploding.
These baubles cling to the curve of your breast.
Small statuettes that contain a false bottom for hiding sacrilegious items.
A black powder used in fireworks and other celebratory activities. Like the upcoming purge of the Queen's enemies.
Crystals will change type when in a prince's territory. The type of gem is different for each prince.
A banded variety of chalcedony. Ha! You are now smarter than your brother.
A green stone that reminds this scholar of your aunt's eyes on that summer dawn.
A shimmering gem of many colors. This one happens to be of the rare non-Australian variety
Fossilized sap. Occasionally pieces contain dead bugs and eternal memories.
A metal that is deeply jealous of gold and all the love it gets. Sometimes found crying itself to sleep.
Diamonds are what happens when you squeeze a tree really tightly. Quite rare due to the Purge of the Tree Squeezers in 40 AD.
A diamond dipped in blue dye
Long ago jewelers sacrificed miniature goats to turn stones red. If you hold a ruby up to your ear, you just might be able to hear the bleating.
No one likes amethyst.
A band wrought of precious materials. It speaks of a promise not always kept.
Necklaces are armor that lay bare our humdrum visage when removed. Invaluable.
A polished shield perfect for hanging on walls in order to pretend that you are manly.
Long of shaft and thick of head, these are not intended to be used on drums. The drum maker is very angry.
Snicker snack! A blade capable of severing a variety of cheeses and cutlets when one feels peckish.
Princes collect scepters much as your or I might collect shoes.
Protection from spirits and hauntings. It never seems to work out as promised in the literature.
The heavy burden of leadership built to rest upon a furrowed brow.
When a standard sized barrel just isn't enough.
The oak preferred by pirates and brigands.
A dense loaf traditionally consumed by soaking in stout
An upscale brick for rich folks that look down on red bricks as plebian.
Aged to maturity in artisanal black oak barrels, a single sip will burn your socks off.
Have a seat.
The lock on the intricate box promises more than the costume jewelry.
This classic desk was popularized in the Elder Puddingham era. No assembly required because flan are not (and never will be) Swedish.
Legalized in three states
Hammer for bashing rock. Used by the workers to the east that lost their jobs and families to the illness with no cure.
A well hopped ale
Sometimes we give bad gifts because we care too much to give fragile feeling form.
My fingers are so sticky. Are your fingers sticky too? Even If you lick them, they don't stop being sticky.
This was once a real cat, but then it was soaked in a special varnish. Now you can pet Fluffy forever.
The poor sell their fillings to be melted into ingots
'The only way to enjoy spicy food is on the way in' -Flannish proverb
This was the meal that the fisherman ate the night before he was lost at sea.
A seafarer's concoction made of weak beer, rum and a dash of lemon to chase off the scurvy.
A hearty southern meal made from beans and locals that did not pay their royal taxes.
An outdated product whose rudderless inventor is likely to go bankrupt in the next decade.
In a well ordered society, it is a neighbor's duty to report unseemly details with great gusto. The spyglass is merely a facilitator.
Now that cigars are banned in public places, consumption of brandy has doubled.
All good moments in life can be slowly stewed in a crockpot. Lift the lid, inhale and remember everything.
An English crisp.
The sort of plated meal a well off bachelor orders when attempting to impress an ingenue
Sniffless and extremely capable of non-emotional bonding.
Baked by lighting a tiny fire inside a bread crust cavity. Eaten by families on Saturday nights.
When cooking pastries only the silkiest baking flour will prevent the chef from smacking you and yelling 'Dolt!'
Wine bewitched with the sweet tears of mispent youth.
'This stealthy rowboat is surprisingly useful if you need to get rid of a body.' Sales brochure, selling point #3.
The simple fact that you do not possess this amazing hair-styling product explains everything that has gone wrong with your life.
A ring of fire. It burns, burns, burns.
When slipped upon a finger, a single twist releases a venom that makes you appear dead for 12 hours.
The sort of thing an insecure man wears in order to pretend that they aren't wearing jewelry.
Traditional dress of the high governors that stoke the fire tower flames.
All you need to do is hug your victim. Please observe that the needles face outward.
Recommended fashion for thick necked individuals with sloping shoulders.
A shield you can hide behind and still see where you are going. Two handed
A shield imbued with expensive cantrips to block the ghost of your mother from seeing what you are doing with your life.
This shield doesn't clank about like all the other shields. Stupid clanking shields.
A little bundle of chilled evil. Don't let it escape.
Those with a friend who is into carpentry, should give this as a present
Behold. Light cream drizzled over warm breadpudding. Heaven awaits.
A child, age 5, broke the last one. Replica pottery ensures that his step-father will never find out.
This barrel prefers the term 'stout' over diminutive titles like 'tiny' or 'dwarven'
Duke Elba sold his soul to the Ice Witch for one stiff drink. This is what he quaffed.
The last warriors of the Flannish took these rations on their suicide mission to vanquish the spirit lords. There are no more warrior flan.
Yes, these prayer stones are made of foam, but it is certified blessed foam.
This is what happens when you cook a barrel of monkeys
Produced by crushing dried mushrooms into powder. A single pinch can aphyxiate a room.
A meal for flan that require two seats when traveling coach.
The famous chef Rotoschooni made this dish for the Princess when he first cooked for her. They eloped that night.
An amulet for the flan that does not need to flaunt their immense wealth.
On the backside of this nondescript scepter is a spout that dispenses black whiskey.
The dour workers of the stony west fear reflections so they scuff their metal and break all foreign mirrors.
The reverse of this pendant states 'In times of need, seek the glow of friends'
An inscription on the side of the scepter reads 'By working together, greatness is inevitable'
Glowing words ring the band, spelling out 'Alone, you are nothing.'
Minions sworn to the creeping ice wear such amulet to keep the heat of love at bay.
The first of the ice lords created this vile device from an inky pool of bitterness.
If you ever stumble upon a shadow crown, burn it with fire. The world hangs in balance.
Amelia Plumson, an artist of great renown, died. Her last wish was to send a last message. This melting statue was found on her daughter's doorstep.
The sculptor of this carving was inspired by a time when he was lost in the subway. A lady with ladybug boots gave him an apple and led him home.
All good things are made of chocolate.
The nation came together to create this great work. The pride you feel comes from the bonds you built.
Friends shield us from loneliness like children shield politicians
No one knows the secret hallucinagenic ingredients of this madman's liquor.
Looks great on a lawn
If children eat this treat with their fingers, they gain the magical ability to climb walls. While giggling maniacly.
Looks so much better than a mana orb. Dear neighbor, "How about them apples?"
Time, like a rampaging herd of wild stallions, leaves behind an amazing quantity of poop.
Stop. Hammered by time. Break me down.
If you must one day put on some pants...make them sparky pants
Hide from the world inside this tiny dull space. No one can poke you now.
Every person who loves you (or your luxuriant hair) decreases your AC by 1.
This is the stuff that makes evil robots impervious to bullets.
Elegance is a small band that accents the sweet bones of the youthful wrist.
Past a certain age, it is wise to trade elegance for "Hey, stop looking at my wrinkles."
A warrior of modern romance knows that the True Love sometimes needs a small kick forward.
My loved one died. Please remember her.
The carved crown was so stunning that his people remembered him as a hero, not a drunk.
The shriveled heart of a flan that did not play nicely with others
